result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:24 AM Defendant Brandon S. Kastner in court.  Attorney Breanne Marie Bucher in court for Brandon S. Kastner.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:29 AM Defendant Brandon S. Kastner in court. Attorney Brandon Carlson appears in court for Attorney Breanne Bucher. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon S. Kastner
Current: W273N2593 Prospect Ave, Richfield, WI 53076 United States  (Effective: 09-06-2022)
Prior: N50w35178 Wisconsin Ave, Oconomowoc, WI 53066

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and drug testing. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody. Defendant to have no contact with Stop N Go/witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

1:35 PM Defendant Brandon S. Kastner in court, in custody. Attorney Angela Wang in court for Brandon S. Kastner.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney.   The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
